original_title: Sri Lanka stocks close up, energy sector attracts interest
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed up on Wednesday, CSE data showed.
The All Share Price Index was up 0.03 percent, or 3.00 points, at 10,703.
The S&P SL20 index was up 0.06 percent, or 1.92 points, at 3,056.
Turnover was at 700 million. The capital goods sector contributed 197 million, utilities sector contributed 107 million, and banks sector contributed 103 million of this.
Market participants said a couple of crossings in John Keells Holdings Plc (down at 192.25) and Windforce Plc (up at 19.10) pushed up turnover.
Top positive contributors to the ASPI were C T Holdings Plc (formerly Ceylon Theatres) (up at 265.00), Expolanka Holdings Plc (up at 132.00), and Melstacorp Plc (up at 80.50). (Colombo/Dec6/2023).
